page.title: 05DAVENPORT THEATRE STOCKPORT
page.content: The Davenport Theatre has been forced to widen its sphere of entertainment in order to avoid closure. Today, as well as plays by local and regional drama groups, it also puts on a Christmas pantomime starring a popular figure,and arranges concerts of popular and classical music. Its main attractions are films. Two films a week are shown, one on the larger screen, and another in a minor theatre which only seats 150 people. The theatre is also used during the daytime for conferences and one of the local schools uses it for Speech Day. {WHAT'S ON?-}At Christmas, Ken Dodd starred in the "Aladdin" pantomime. Recent films are "Passage to India", "Police Academy" and "The Killing Fields". Future stage shows include a "Jazz and Blues" night with Acker Bilk, Chris Barber and Kenny Ball.
